page.title: 04SOUTHILL HOUSE. (TWO)
page.content: He had no children,and after his death it was handed down to the third {Chetham}brother.This happened once more but this time the brother had children. The dining room,during the 19 century was used as servants' quarters.The windows were very high up the walls. This was to stop the servants looking out when they should be working. There is a beautiful staircase, it is made from 3 different woods:{Mahogony, {Elm}and{Oak.}Out in the hay loft some of the beams are over 500 years old.It is written that the{Duke of Monmouth stayed at Southill House overnight as a guest of Edward Strode when he was fleeing from the{Battle of Sedgemoor.
